title: Pride of Britain Awards: Love Island's Molly-Mae Hague takes inspiration from Hailey Bieber
text:
She cosied up to her beau Tommy Fury on the red carpet for Pride of Britain Awards at the Grosvenor House Hotel in London on Monday.

And it has now been revealed that Molly-Mae Hague attended the glittering event with a budget pink dress from online retailer Pretty Little Thing, which retails at £35.

The Love Island star also took style inspiration from American model Hailey Bieber, who wore a very similar gown and hairdo for the Met Gala earlier this year.

Budget: It has now been revealed that Molly-Mae Hague attended the Pride Of Britain Awards with a pink dress from online retailer Pretty Little Thing, which retails at £35

Molly-Mae turned heads on the red carpet where she donned a bespoke pink off the shoulder dress, which boasted one long sleeve and a flowing train.

However, months earlier Hailey was seen wearing a very similar dress in a backless pink dress with her blonde locks slicked into place with a chunky black headband.

Molly-Mae also took to Instagram to share a snap of Hailey, revealing: 'My favourite red carpet look EVER. I have always wanted to recreate...'

Seeing double: The Love Island star also took style inspiration from American model Hailey Bieber (R) who wore a very similar gown and hairdo for the Met Gala earlier this year

'My favourite red carpet look EVER': Molly-Mae also took to Instagram to share a snap of Hailey

The garment featured a cut out at the midriff and a pleated detail that accentuated the Love Island star's sensational physique.

Also sporting glittering designer earrings, Molly-Mae styled her platinum blonde locks into a ponytail for the evening.

Tommy looked dapper for the occasion in a navy blazer with a black floral print which he paired with a crisp white shirt and black trousers.

Wrapping his arm around his significant other, the boxer completed his look for the evening with a black bow tie and matching loafers.

Dapper: Tommy and Molly-Mae looked every inch the happy couple as they attended the Pride of Britain Awards

Beauty: Molly-Mae turned heads on the red carpet where she donned a bespoke pink off the shoulder dress from PrettyLittleThing, which boasted one long sleeve and a flowing train

The couple's outing comes after they recently revealed they hope to start a family together in the future.

Fielding a host of questions sent to the couple via Instagram, Molly-Mae responded when asked about starting a family: 'We both definitely want children. But obviously we're both only 20 years old.'

However, Tommy – whose older brother is fellow boxer Tyson Fury – quickly interjected: 'We've been trying to make children most nights.'

While his claims were met with denials by his blonde girlfriend, Tommy pressed on: 'Yes, we have. We've been snoodling in the bedroom, I want twins by the time I'm 22, simple as that... Molly wants six kids, I want eight.'

After much playful band-and-forth between the couple, social media influencer Molly-Mae later stated that she would like to have two children, prompting Tommy to respond that he wants four.

However, the pair, whose run on Love Island concluded at the end of July, were a lot more in sync when revealing that they've never had a row since leaving the villa.

Responding to an enquiry about their biggest argument thus far, Molly-Mae said: 'Now honestly, this isn't even a lie, we've not had one argument.'

Added Tommy: 'Literally not one. That's what I said, could you even pick one?'

Style: Also sporting glittering designer earrings, Molly-Mae styled her platinum blonde locks into a ponytail for the evening

His girlfriend gushed: 'We just constantly laugh. I'm not even just saying this to be like, "Oh we're the perfect couple," because we're not, but we just don't argue.'

More than 100 of the UK's biggest stars will come together at the Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards to honour the nation's unsung heroes on the landmark 20th anniversary of the event.

The awards recognise and celebrate ordinary people up and down the country doing extraordinary things.

Suave: Tommy looked dapper for the occasion in a navy blazer with a black floral print which he paired with a crisp white shirt and black trousers

Hosted by Carol Vorderman, celebrities and public figures including Prince Charles, Robert Downey Jr, Sir Ben Kingsley, Dua Lipa, Ant & Dec, Chris Pratt, Michael Sheen, Adam Lambert, Christine Lampard, Sir Michael Caine, Jonathan Ross, Suranne Jones, and the judges and casts of Strictly Come Dancing and The X Factor will be honouring this year's awe-inspiring winners.

Carol Vorderman said: 'Pride of Britain is such a huge part of my life, it's hard to believe it's 20 years since we first started. In that time, it has found a place at the heart of British life, and the winners represent the very best of us. I never fail to be humbled by them, and this year's are no different.'

The Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards, in partnership with TSB, will be broadcast on ITV on 5th November at 8pm.
